creator: seade@apache.org
text:
Just as the images downloaded by the "Retrieve All Images and Java Applets"
option renders the images it downloads, there should be a way of indicating that
the response to an actual HTTP request should be rendered as an image.  This
might be a flag set at script creation time or a button along the lines of the
existing "Render HTML" one that can be used when viewing results.

creator: mramshaw@alumni.concordia.ca
text: I'm not getting this. Could you be a little more specific ?

As a workaround to http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=16060 I was
coding explicit requests for images in my test scripts (but it is still relevant
not as a workaround).  When an images are retrieved as a result of "Retrieve All
Images..." the actual imaged are rendered when you click on them in the test
results.  For the images I explicitly requested the results were rendered as
binary data.  It seemed to me that from the request JMeter shouls have been able
to determine that the request was for an image and thus render it, or
alternatively I should somehow be able to indicate to JMeter that I wanted these
requests rendered as images.
